entry.title: Getting all senders with notmuch
entry.summary:
The problem we are trying to solve is this: I am using notmuch and I got a mail within the last 3 months from someone that i remember nothing about but when I see their email I will know it were them. So let's use notmuch, python and awk to solve this.

First let's find out how to tell notmuch to search within that periond. Experimenting is usually faster than looking up documentation when it comes to notmuch so after 2 or 3 attempts:

$ notmuch count "date:3M.."
1817

Which sounds about right.

The following command assumes just vanilla python and notmuch:

$ notmuch show --body=false --format=json "data:3M.." | python -mjson.tool | awk '/"From":/{$1=""; print $0}' | sort | uniq
...

And it will return a list of all the unique senders of emails within the last 3 months. They are about 500 in my case so i can skim through them or add extra search criteria.

Just to give some well deserved credit all the above commands were completed almost instantaneously.
